intro:
ZeroNet Spaceship XO

*nix Sysadmin/grunt

[The Blinking Prompt Times █](http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq)
[My Zeronet add-on for Firefox 🦊 : znqa (clearnet)](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/znqa/)

post.body: Hello ZeroMe ! I lost my users.json from a few months ago ...oops. I'm interested in all things Free Software / Linux/BSD / filesharing and so on :)

New zite ! I'm experimenting with H.265 encoding for tiny file sizes and ZeroUp, feedback welcome (also come discover a nice sci-fi serie if you don't know it yet!) http://127.0.0.1:43110/16VPSqtCYkueRqxJCfs6rFQrAQzEwEm3HG/
Ok, I cannot sign my zite using the UI but CLI works (yay!) anyone would have a clue ? @Nofish ? :)
Is there a way on ZeroUp to see all uploads from a certain user ? Browsing the list with "Show more..." doesn't scale well. @nofish@zeroid.bit: Bothering you again :p <3

I've now a blog called The Blinking Prompt Times █  ! I will be sharing short and not-so-short tips and tricks, news about computers and Unix I've learned along the way, come take a look ! http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq

@nofish@zeroid.bit: I always have Content signing failed
Include optional files too large 2864574139B > 1000000000B when I "upload" on ZeroUp, is it problematic to share files ?
What logging on Zeronet sometimes feels like :p still love you zeropeers ! (clearnet gif : http://gifimage.net/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/john-travolta-pulp-fiction-gif-2.gif)
New post on The Blinking Prompt Times █  : Spotlight: the fish shell ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:4:An+introduction+to+the+fish+shell )

@nofish: Hello ! I'm tinkering with JS and Firefox WebExt but I'm struggling to get a working code to find a string on a ZeroNet page (say ZeroHello), would you have any quick pointers for me ? (specifically, the window.onload check is unreliable for zeronet pages ? Or am I missing something ?)

I've got a tiny prototype going on in the form of a Firefox Webextension : Persistent links towards various parts of Zeronet without the need to go back to ZeroHello or use bookmarks. Any thoughts, ideas or requests ?

New blog post : Introducing my first WebExtension (for Zeronet of course) : znqa http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:5:Introducing+my+first+WebExtension+:+znqa+! Thanks @Gitcenter for hosting my sources the Zeronet way :) !
Aaand we have an initial custom zites support in znqa ! New blog post : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:6:znqa+0.1.4+:+Initial+customization+support

New blog post, save energy by putting your Linux box to sleep under certain conditions : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:8:A+simple+script+to+automatically+put+your+Linux+computer+to+sleep

Well it's been a long time ZeroNet, but I always come back to poke at you from time to time and be amazed about how well it works and a bit sad about your adoption state. Much love either way <3

Also, new post on The Blinking Prompt Times ! http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:9

Some digression, Blade Runner 2036 : Nexus Dawn is a short film (6min) set on the universe of Blade Runner 2049 and it's great ! You can enjoy it the ZeroNet way on IFS : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:1Mz1_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8_item_6+type:video
Are gifs working ? I hope so ! What do you think about this "flower" interface for znqa ? Also, support for up to 4 personal zites is coming :)
Oops gifs are not supported in here. Here's the interface when clicked. The spacing is off, it's just a prototype :)

znqa 0.1.8 is out ! The always-on shortcut button to your favorites ZeroNet sites now supports up to 4 custom sites and has a new fancy UI. Grab it while it's hot at https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/znqa/ (clearnet link)
@Gitcenter : Hello ! Is there a way to delete a Gitcenter repo ? I made a mess back then and I would like to restart from scratch :)
Kids See Ghosts self-titled album is pretty good if you're into Hip-Hop !
New blog post : A year's dusk : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:11:A+year%27s+dusk+%F0%9F%8C%86
New blog post : Twitter in an isolated Firefox window : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:12:Script+:+Twitter+in+an+isolated+Firefox+window
New blog post (first in 6 months, damn!) : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:13:Script+:+Wake+your+Linux+system+at+a+certain+time+with+rtcwake

New blog post on The Blinking Prompt Times █ :

Linux gaming in spaaaaace ! 🛸

http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:14:James+Holden+Linux+games+mini+review+1+:+Interstellar+Marines

My blog has a new look ! Currently only available in dark mode, come visit The Blinking Prompt Times █ #TBPT : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/

Edit : And light theme is up!
@nofish : Hello ! How can I make a single file optional for my ZeroBlog ? 🤔
New blog post, my Firefox add-on "znqa" is back ! http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:17:znqa+0.1.9+(reupload+on+Mozilla+add-ons)
Thoughts on a vertical layout for znqa ? The rationale being that it might hide less of the page contents. I also thinking at making the choice possible between circle and vertical layout :)
New blog post : znqa 0.2.0 is out ! http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:20:znqa+0.2.0+is+out+!
New blog posts after 6 months away from Zeronet 😁 : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:21:Encrypt+you+local+network+traffic+with+tinc
New blog post, the time about money and decentralized finance #defi ! http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:23:A+few+words+about+decentralized+finance+defi
New blog post ! Decentralized projects I like : Filecoin http://127.0.0.1:43110/12zNqmKW8bLAhAASydBAYvo9Csy2ppQEqq/?Post:24:Decentralized+protocols+I+like+:+Filecoin

comment.body: @styromaniac@zeroid.bit: :D If I would be so fortunate to leave near the ocean, sure !
@Nofish: Nothing at all (no notification pop up), clicking "publish" give me the grey button with the spinner-like animation but it doesn't work either.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Thanks, appreciated :)
@Git Center: Thanks for the tip, I tried with --debug myself and absolutely nothing happens when clicking `sign`
@Git Center: Indeed nothing in dev tools (tried on Firefox,All or Network pane) but reloading the page with F5 doesn't do the trick for me either
@Binchan: Can confirm ! Thanks all :)

@Binchan: I'll have a look at those options, thanks ! I'm a bit sad there's no permalink to a user's uploads since it's a covenient way to allow leechs to become seeds if they wish, if I just link the ZeroUp file, it wont be seeded right away (since it's an action you need to take in the UI)
@Kaffie: Sounds cool ! It's a much needed feature

@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Not that I can think of, only recent thing is that I migrated my users.json from another machine a few days ago. Would you be willing to try to download a file I recently uploaded there ? e.g : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8/The.Expanse.S02E05.FASTSUB.VOSTFR.HDTV.x265-JHTINY.mp4
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Nope, one at a time (and the other is out now so only on one onwards)
@Binchan: Aah, that's why ! Thanks for the tip, will do :)
Ah fellow BOINC user, I am computing for years too :) curious as to how Gridcoin will work for you, let us know !
@Kaffie: Well said :)
@Johnny Mnemonic: I can. Last post is from 19 Jan :)
I'm not surprised, LaTeX is unfortunately notoriously huge to install
@Git Center: Thanks for the tip ! Will take a look again, back to the drawing board :)

@Binchan: Good idea I would love to ! Actually my first idea was to add notification support (as notification bubbles/popup) to the ZeroHello page, so far it seems kind of tricky to work with how Zeronet display pages (iframe) ... but this is perhaps because I never really wrote JS before now :p
@Tangdou: Thanks :)

@Git Center: Hey ! Thank you so much for the bug report ! Indeed, for now I kind of expected that kind off issues since I'm not handling positioning in a proper, responsive way right now, I'll make sure to improve and hopefully fix that at the next release ! As for where to post future bug reports, I don't really mind but if we can leverage your good work and use Gitcenter then why not ! :)
@Git Center: I've made a (tentative) fix in 0.1.5, feel free to let me know how it goes !
@Git Center: Cool ! \o/
@Piloth: You should be now, at least while my workstation is online :)
@Eibriel: Hey thanks, great blog btw, I am seeding :) !

@Krixano: Hey thanks ! You actually made a contribution :) Indeed it seems Zirch Search Engine has much more sites and would make a sensible default search engine. The v0.1.7 add-on update is already available on https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/znqa/

@Cloudysocks: Thanks ! I didn't knew about the tumblr floating buttons but looking at it, it's pretty close for sure ! ZNQA stands for ZeroNet Quick Access, it's just a UI to have your shortcuts on every zeronet page since the menu with you pinned sites is only available on the ZeroHello page :)

@ZeroLSTN: I started using GitCenter but it's not up-to-date over there. I made a zip of the latest code and put it on IFS : http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:1Mz1_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8_item_7+type:archive

Disclaimer : I am not a JS developer but feedback welcome :p
@ZeroLSTN: I totally agree, I just need to spend some time to figure out Gitcenter workflow :)

@ZeroLSTN: The thing is, I already have a (local) git repo for znqa which is away from my ZeroNet data folder and it seems to complicate the setup a hell lot more. Adding the origin like you said "works" but I cannot push (git ask me to pull first) and I cannot pull either (fatal: refusing to merge unrelated histories)

I'll try again tomorrow :)
@Cloudysocks: I am really glad you like it ! Enjoy and feel free to make improvements requests :)
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Too annoying to setup compared to rtcwake which was one download away :) also I can bundle everything I want before/after the wakeup within a script
@caryoscelus: Thanks, good catch ! I tweaked it, it looks better now I believe :)
@caryoscelus: All fair points ! I didn't realize it was that easy to change the avatar actually. How do you like it now ? :)

@Wanditoast: Zeronet doesn't have a navigation bar so when you are let's say on ZeroMe and want to visit a blog, you need to go back to ZeroHello then reach the blog through the left panel.

The add-on allows you to save 4 zeronet URLs for faster access to the sites you visit the most :)
Thanks for the blocklist, I am using it :) Also using the MOAB at http://127.0.0.1:43110/Styromaniac.blocklist.bit/

@Firtzgobery: Thanks ! As for the planet icon issue, well, I think it's not a bug but a feature :p You can configure those 4 icons to point to any link you want :) You can do so on the add-ons option page.
